summary: The 'No Tax on Overtime for All Workers Act' seeks to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The bill proposes allowing a tax deduction for certain overtime compensation. Specifically, it defines 'qualified overtime compensation' to include overtime pay exceeding the regular rate under the Fair Labor Standards Act, or pay exceeding the regular rate in situations defined by the bill, such as specified work hours and agreement with the employer. The amendment would be applicable to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024.
